授業方法:
For the Spring semester 2022, this course will be held face to face, but may include some ONLINE content in both simultaneous two-way or on-demand format.

< For students permitted to take classes online > - On-demand broadcast of data recorded from face-to-face classes via Google Classroom. Students need to check LUNA for more details on accessing Google Classroom

Thus, students will NEED access to a computer at home (not just a smartphone) or use a school computer lab to be able to properly complete and submit assignments. Desktop, laptop, notebook, Macbook, etc, are fine. Students should also have a Google account and sign up for Google Drive and Google Classroom (both are for free).

Lessons will be designed to foster student autonomy and enhance students' ability to critically assess written materials and oral presentations/lectures in and English-only environment.

Students can expect regular teacher lectures, presentations, and actively discuss and review course content through pair work or small groups

トピック.授業外学習2:
Students must have regular access to computers and the internet either at home or through an on-campus computer lab. Online, on-demand or simultaneous interactive tasks may be required.

The amount of study time for homework will vary from week to week and will depend on 1) the content being reviewed, and 2) the ability of individual students to understand the content to complete tasks. However, students can expect to do a minimum of 1 hours and a maximum of 2 hours of study each week.

In some cases, students will need to review and assess a segment of film multiple times in preparation for or prior to completing an assignment
